SEARCH
Package Networking

Class TCPServer

java.lang.Object
Networking.TCPServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Communicator
class TCPServer extends Object implements Communicator
The TCPServer class implements the Communicator interface and represents a TCP server. It handles incoming client connections, pinging clients, and sending/receiving packets.
Author:
haotian

  • Constructor Details

    • TCPServer

      public TCPServer()
      Constructs a NetworkManager.

    • TCPServer

      public TCPServer(NetworkHandler handler) throws IOException, IllegalArgumentException
      Constructs a TCPServer object with the specified NetworkHandler.
      Parameters:
      handler - the NetworkHandler object to be associated with the server
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs when opening the server socket
      IllegalArgumentException - if the port parameter is outside the specified range of valid port values

      Parameters:
      handler - the network handler

      public void close()
      Closes the network connection and sets the closed flag to true.

      Allows or disallows new clients to join.
      Parameters:

    • addThread

      public void addThread(CompletableFuture future)
      Adds a CompletableFuture to the list of ongoing network operations.
      Parameters:
      future - the CompletableFuture to add

    • isClosed

      public boolean isClosed()
      Returns whether the connection is closed.
      Returns:
      true if the connection is closed, false otherwise

    • isAllowJoining

      public boolean isAllowJoining()
      Returns whether joining is allowed.
      Returns:

      Returns the list of ongoing network operations.
      Returns:
      the list of CompletableFuture objects

    • Start

      public void Start()
      Starts the network handler by listening for clients and initiating pinging.
      Specified by:
      Start in interface Communicator

    • StartPinging

      private void StartPinging()
      Starts pinging the connected clients to check their availability. If a client does not respond within the specified timeout period, it will be removed from the list of clients.

    • listenForClient

      private void listenForClient()
      Listens for incoming client connections and handles them accordingly. This method runs asynchronously in a separate thread.

    • removeClient

      public void removeClient(NetworkUser client)
      Removes a client from the network. If the client is local, the method returns without performing any action. Otherwise, it sends a "KICKED" message to the client and closes the connection.
      Parameters:
      client - The client to be removed from the network.

    • startListening

      public void startListening(NetworkUser client)
      Starts listening for incoming network messages from the specified client.
      Parameters:
      client - The NetworkUser object representing the client.

    • SendPacket

      public void SendPacket(Packet packet)
      Sends a packet to the specified client.
      Specified by:
      SendPacket in interface Communicator
      Parameters:
      packet - the packet to be sent

    • Stop

      public void Stop()
      Stops the network handler and closes all client connections. This method sets the 'closed' flag to true, sends a "SERVER_CLOSE" message to all clients, and closes the connections, input streams, and output streams of each client. Finally, it closes the server socket and cancels all running threads.
      Specified by:
      Stop in interface Communicator

    • AllowJoining

      public void AllowJoining()
      Allows joining of new connections.

    • DenyJoining

      public void DenyJoining()
      Sets the allowJoining flag to false, denying any further joining requests.
